inclusion.criterion: Physician diagnosis of peanut allergy OR convincing clinical history of an allergic reaction to peanut.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Detectable serum peanut-specific IgE level (CAP-FEIA ≥ 0.35 kU/L) and a positive SPT (wheal ≥ 3mm on skin prick test to peanut extract compared to a negative control).
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Allergic reaction to ≤ 1 gm peanut protein during a blinded oral challenge test conducted at screening (e.g., a double-blinded, placebo-controlled food challenge [DBPCFC]).
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Written assent from subject if applicable
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of allergic reaction to peanut consistent with severe anaphylaxis (defined as hypotension/shock; or neurologic impairment).
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Chronic disease other than asthma, atopic dermatitis, rhinitis requiring therapy;
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Active eosinophilic gastrointestinal disease in the past 2 years
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Participation in any interventional study for the treatment of food allergy in the 6 months prior to visit -1
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Healthy woman with no underlying disease, taking multivitamins and anti-hypertensive drugs. Exercises regularly.
